events.name: Apps4VA HAC4EDU Arlington
events.about:
Apps4VA is sponsoring 5 simultaneous 24-hour hackathons to develop software applications using education data.  Cash and other prizes will be awarded to winners.  Well supply food, snacks, and data.  You supply energy, excitement and ingenuity! 

Apps4VA is an collaborative effort between the Center for Innovative Technology and the Virginia Department of Education to encourage the development of new and innovative ways to use and analyze education data.  For more information on the program, visit http://www.apps4va.org/index.html

events.name: Cloud Foundry Dev Day DC
events.about:
THE NEW DATE HAS BEEN SET! and we'll have a whole team on site to guide you through the very hands-on day!

#CFDevDayDC

This hands-on Developer Day will ramp you up from hello world to building sample apps on Cloud Foundry's hosted and Private PaaS options. Meet our experts, Patrick Chanezon, Chris Richardson, Josh Long and many others, who will guide you through our Cloud Foundry vision, getting started, Cloud Foundry internals and architecture, setting up your own private PaaS using Cloud Foundry Bosh, and additional hackathon.

This is a follow-up from our successful date on the Cloud Foundry Open Tour in DC. For newcomers, we will walk you through the basics and ramp you up for the rest of the day. For previous attendees, you can review the bootcamp or join us after the bootcamp for a great day of hand-on work.

Here is an overview of the day:

8:30-9:15 am: Check in
9:15-10:15 am: Cloud Foundry vision and abbreviated boot camp
10:15 am: coffee break
10:30-11:30 am: Hello world through your first sample apps

11:30 am-12:15 pm: Networking lunch

Afternoon: Two Tracks
12:15-1:00 pm:
Track 1: Cloud Foundry internals and architecture pt. 1
Track 2: Sample app hackathon step-by-step pt. 1
1:00 pm: coffee break
1:15-2:00 pm:
Track 1: Cloud Foundry internals and architecture pt. 2
Track 2: Sample app hackathon step-by-step pt. 2
2:00-2:30 pm: snack break
2:30-3:15 pm:
Track 1: Private PaaS step-by-step set up pt. 1
Track 2: Sample app hackathon step-by-step pt. 3
3:15 pm: coffee break
3:30-4:15 pm:
Track 1: Private PaaS step-by-step set up pt. 2
Track 2: Sample app hackathon step-by-step pt. 4
4:15-4:45 pm: Last questions

**If you don't have a Cloud Foundry account, please sign up at cloudfoundry.com and use this Promo code for automatic approval: CFDevDayDC2012

The event is located at Artisphere in Arlington, VA (artisphere.com, @artisphere). It is on 1101 Wilson Blvd, a block from the Rosslyn Metro station. Parking is also available.

events.name: Cloud Foundry Dev Day DC
events.about:
#CFDevDayDC

This hands-on Developer Day will ramp you up from hello world to building sample apps on Cloud Foundrys hosted and Private PaaS options. Meet our experts, Josh Long and Dave McCrory, who will guide you through our Cloud Foundry vision, getting started, Cloud Foundry internals and architecture, setting up your own private PaaS using Cloud Foundry Bosh, and additional hackathon.

This is a follow-up from our successful date on the Cloud Foundry Open Tour in DC. For newcomers, we will walk you through the basics and ramp you up for the rest of the day. For previous attendees, you can review the bootcamp or join us after the bootcamp for a great day of hand-on work.

Here is an overview of the day:

8:30-9:15 am: Check in
9:15-10:20 am: Dave McCrory: Cloud Foundry vision and boot camp
10:20 am: coffee break
10:30-11:30 am: Josh Long: Hello world through your first sample apps
11:30 am-12:30 pm: Networking lunch

Afternoon: Two Tracks
12:30-1:20 pm:
Track 1: Cloud Foundry internals and architecture pt. 1 (Dave McCrory)
Track 2: Sample app hackathon step-by-step pt. 1 (Josh Long)
1:20 pm: coffee break
1:30-2:20 pm:
Track 1: Cloud Foundry internals and architecture pt. 2 (Dave McCrory)
Track 2: Sample app hackathon step-by-step pt. 2 (Josh Long)
2:20-2:40 pm: snack break
2:40-3:30 pm: 
Track 1: Private PaaS step-by-step set up pt. 1 (Dave McCrory)
Track 2: Sample app hackathon step-by-step pt. 3 (Josh Long)
3:30 pm: coffee break
3:40-4:30 pm:
Track 1: Private PaaS step-by-step set up pt. 2 (Dave McCrory)
Track 2: Sample app hackathon step-by-step pt. 4 (Josh Long)
4:30-5:00 pm: Wrap up, last questions with Dave and Josh

**If you dont have a Cloud Foundry account, please sign up at cloudfoundry.com and use this Promo code for automatic approval: CFDevDayDC2012

The event is located at Artisphere in Arlington, VA (artisphere.com, @artisphere). It is on 1101 Wilson Blvd, a block from the Rosslyn Metro station. Parking is also available.

events.name: Voting Information Project (VIP) Hackathon
events.about:
Heading to the VIP Hackathon and TransparencyCamp? Register for both in one swoop by clicking here!

For years, high quality information about one of our democracy’s most critical activities has been nearly impossible to come by -- that is, until the Voting Information Project (VIP) was born. The Pew Center on the States launched this initiative in 2008 to become the 21st century transmission line between election offices and voters. VIP answers voters’ most common questions -- things like “where do I vote?”, “who is on my ballot?”, and “how do I navigate the voting process?” -- by making official information available in the places where voters are looking for it, whether online or on their mobile devices. 

Now, in this hot-button election year, Pew and their partners at Microsoft, Google, and AT&T are inviting you to roll up your sleeves and help make a difference. On April 30, 2012, join Pew, Microsoft, the Sunlight Foundation, and many others as we unleash the potential of this amazing and timely collection of civic data.

What tools do you need to be a better citizen? What app would get your friends out to the voting booth? What data would benefit your local board of elections? Come mash, hack, and mindmeld with other civic hackers and problem-solve these and other exciting questions.

For more information on the Voting Information Project, head here. For more details on the hackathon, click here.

events.name: Transparency Camp Hackathon
events.about:
The Sunlight Foundation’s popular open government “unconference,” TransparencyCamp, is back and coming soon to the Washington, DC area. For its fifth convening, Sunlight will host a weekend conference and accompanying hackathon on April 28-29 and April 30, respectively.

At TransparencyCamp 2012, attendees will lead sessions on issues surrounding government transparency, openness and accountability facing the country and global community. This “unconference” brings together government officials, technologists, journalists and grassroots advocates to share best practices on the ways new technologies and effective policies can make our government really work for the people. Over the years, TransparencyCamp served as the starting point for a number of national open government programs and initiatives, including CityCamp and CrisisCamps, as well as inspiring international TCamps around the globe.

More details and videos about TransparencyCamp are available at http://transparencycamp.org/.

Sunlight is also hosting a hackathon with The Pew Center on the States and Microsoft on Monday, April 30, focusing on civic data from the Voting Information Project. Developers can learn more at http://transparencycamp.org/viphackathon/.

WHAT:    TransparencyCamp 2012

WHEN:    Saturday, April 28 and Sunday April 29 from 9:00 am to 5:00 pm (each day)

WHERE:    Founders Hall – George Mason University
3351 Fairfax Drive, Arlington, VA
Metro: Virginia Square (Orange line)

COST:
$20 for attendees, $10 for students
Register online at http://tcamp12.eventbrite.com/
Media interested in attending, please contact us.

CONTACT:
Liz Bartolomeo, communications manager
liz@sunlightfoundation.com
202-742-1520 x226
